intro: Mundia montana, commonly known as the mountain mundia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers that are often fragrant. Mundia montana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
